subject: Re: [junit] Quering sqlite3 database in junit framework
msgSnippet: I would investigate DBUnit... it is geared to working with databases. ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
I would investigate DBUnit... it is geared to working with databases.

On Thu, Jul 8, 2010 at 9:13 AM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:

>
>
> Hi, ksgupta1986,
>
> Can you narrow down your question? For example, do you already have
> code that can query the database? Thanks,
>
> David Saff
>
>
> On Wed, Jul 7, 2010 at 5:47 AM, ksgupta1986 <ksgupta1986@...<ksgupta1986%40yahoo.co.in>>
> wrote:
> > I am using junit framework, within that i am working with selenium-rc
> commands.
> >
> > I just need to access the database so as to fetch the values and compare
> with the actual value.
> >
> > DB table format:
> >
> > Testcaseno Expected
> > --------- --------
> > 1 true (string)
> > 2 1234 (string)
> >
> >
> > In the junit framework i need to access the each and every row for its
> values and compare with the actual string values.
> >
> > Example
> > compare(DB.table.Expected(1st row), actual);
> >
> > Actions to be done.
> > 1. Connect to db.
> > 2. Fetch the row values.
> > 3. Compare with actual value got.
> > 4. Close the connection.
> >
> > How can implement this using JUNIT FW.
> >
> > Can some one help me by providing some sample examples related to my
> requirment.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > ------------------------------------
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
>
